contents.markdown: _Mang_- verbs are second tier AF verbs. Verb affixes that end in _ng_, of which _mang_- is the most common by far, have a tendency to morph when they attach themselves with certain roots. There are so many rules for this that they are not worth memorizing, but the result is that _mang_- verbs often look like _ma_- verbs. The _ng_ often changes into either _m_ or _n_, and may or may not replace the first letter of the root.
Despite all the morphing, all aspects can be derived from the infinitive, so memorizing the infinitive is enough.
_Mang_- verbs are AF, with possible variants AF(O), AF(D) and AF(I)
_Mang_- verbs aspects are formed as shown. Notice that it has the same aspect formation and stress pattern rules as _ma_- verbs.

item.tagalog: Nanonood si Maria ng TV araw-araw.
Sinabi niya sa akin kung ano ang nangyari.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kailangan ni Analyng mamili, kasi magkakaroon siya ng aso bukas.
exampleSentences.english: Analyn needs to shop, because she will have a dog tomorrow.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi siya nakatutok kapag nanonood siya ng TV, no?
exampleSentences.english: He is not focused when he watches TV, is he?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ano ang nangyari? Naging guro ba siya?
exampleSentences.english: What happened? Did she became a teacher?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Naniwala ba si Diegong meron na akong bahay?
exampleSentences.english: Did Diego believe that I have a house already?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi ako nakakain, kaya namasyal ako.
exampleSentences.english: I was not able to eat, so I went for a walk.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Namili ba si Mark para makapagluto ng lechon?
exampleSentences.english: Did Mark go shopping in order to cook lechon?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nagkapera ang nanonood ng TV nung taong dalawang libo't anim.
exampleSentences.english: The one watching TV had money in the year 2006.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Malalaman ni Jasmine kung ano ang mangyayari sa Huwebes
exampleSentences.english: Jasmine will find out what is happening on Thursday..

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi ako naniniwala sa maraming bagay.
exampleSentences.english: I do not believe in many things.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Huwag po kayong mamasyal nang alas nuwebe ng gabi.
exampleSentences.english: Do not go for a walk at 9pm. (resp.)
